description:
The summary: not really a tiki bar. A dive bar that maybe used to be a tiki bar. Some games, random decor, an awesome back patio, middle-tier drinks with heavy pours, and a decent happy hour.

What's good? Drinks are less than $10, the pours are heavy, and if you like divey atmospheres, this is a great place. Sweet (newly renovated) patio!!

What's bad? Well, it's not really a tiki bar too much. Don't come here expecting an extensive cocktail menu, custom tiki cups, or tiki historical references. It's also divey, so if that's not your scene, this isn't your scene. Also the prices are only alright...they're not as good as say, trader vic's, which also has an awesome variety of tiki drinks.
author: Chris S.

description:
Came on a Friday night and it didn't disappoint - probably because my pals told me not to expect much other than it was a fun dive bar to get cheap drinks and maybe shoot some hoops. I did one of those two things and it was fine.

They'll make a mean well drink or serve you up a semi-cold glass of beer on tap, but I'd stay away from their specialty cocktails as I was getting some puckered faces when friends took their first sip. They're cheap - so don't expect fancy craft concoctions. And if you're only sporting plastic in your wallet, you'll be in a world of hurt as they only accept cash. They do have an ATM on site with some nice fees, but if you want to imbibe, that's the price you pay for your liquor.

I heard the place gets packed around 930/10PM on the weekends, other than that there was plenty of spots to sit around the bar and it wasn't super loud where we couldn't hold a conversation.

Would for sure come back, the price was right and I had a good time.
author: Ryan C.

description:
It's a dive bar that seems like it might be a tiki bar but its def still a dive bar and for that it's great at what it is. 

+ Questionable communal snack mix in little dishes at the bar
+ Cash only
+ Cheap drinks
+ Maybe the worst mai tai I've ever had but it was still drinkable so, maybe just stick to beer as one should in a dive bar

I'm no regular of the Marina but I get the sense that this neighborhood isn't likely to be a place I will frequently find myself or make the trek to but Mauna Loa is a great place for us plebes to go in this neck of the woods to have a very adequate good time.
author: Candice G.

description:
Fun dive-y bar in the heart of the Marina. It's a much welcome change of pace from nearby Balboa Cafe, Eastside West, or the Matrix. 

Perks:
- cheap drinks 
- kitschy/tiki bar meets sports bar atmosphere
- they have fun games (pool table, hoops, etc.) to accompany your beverages.

Cons:
- Cash bar
- not exactly the friendliest bartenders on the block.
- don't come in here expecting craft cocktails (stick with beers and shots).
- depending on the time of night, it can get super crowded. So if you're looking to have an actual conversation with your drinking buddies, get here on the earlier side.

All in all, Mauna Loa remains a reliable Marina staple, so long as you don't come in with high expectations.
author: Kevin B.

description: Great divey tiki bar! Drinks a little overpriced for the ingredients/atmosphere but still a fun spot!
author: Emma V.

description:
My favorite bar in SF. Kurt is a great guy to
hang out. I've known Kurt for nearly 30 years. I have many fond memories, including meeting my wife pilar and %
 sarurdayxws
author: Jack C.

description: Totally a dive bar in a great location. Like everyone else has posted don't expect much. The bartender seemed kind of off, but she was sweet - When I asked for a happy hour Jameson special because it was about 7pm and it didn't end till 8pm Mon-Fri she didn't know there was happy hour, I'm not mad at her. If I worked at a bar I'm sure I wouldn't know happy hour if I only worked late evenings. I would come again, wish their were bar seats available and took cards as well instead of just cash - that why we were onto the next one.
author: Tawny V.

description:
Discrimination at its finest -

This bar is one of the rudest bars I've ever been to and the bouncer is a huge douche.. and I'm from NYC so I think that holds some weight.

My friends and I showed up on a Friday night after getting a recommendation from the waiter at Umami Burger down the street: go to Mauna Loa bar - it's a good time, tell them Chava sent you, and they'll take care of you.

Upon arriving, there was nobody outside of the bar, so we strolled in. A few seconds later, a 'bouncer,' or should I say, 9th year of college frat bro who doesn't even know how to do his job, asked us to "back up" and step outside since he needed to card us. "Back up, back up, back up, go outside." Already, that's a bit rude, but expected from crappy bouncers in the Marina, so we're fine with that. But, when I proceed to ask very nicely - "Hey, we got sent over from Chava and he said really good things and that you guys are a great time - are there any specials or deals tonight?" - he proceeds to very facetiously say "Umm... nope!" and brushes us off. 

At this very same time, a group of blond girls and guys walk in, and the bouncer just smiles and nods them in without carding. We're not sure why they're getting in so easily when we've already had several bad quips from the bouncer.

Finally, we get in and decide to let it go. But, I did tell him, "Look, I think you were sort of rude when we came in." He completely brushes it off and says, again, sarcastically, "Oh, you didn't like the way I said no?" Yeah, douche, not really.

After 30 minutes or so when we decide to leave, I can't help but let him know, "Again, you were extremely rude and honestly discriminatory," to which he was completely surprised by. "Discriminatory?" Yeah, you were. You clearly had much more positive interactions with all the other customers in the bar, and news flash: discrimination is when you treat different types of people differently. It's hard to trace the why behind the actions, but the actions were very clear. 

Not long after, we asked for his manager to discuss the problem. This part's hilarious. He sends another bartender who is probably 7 years old and acts that way too. We then ask for someone who is truly more senior, and the 2nd woman that comes out is the same joke the rest of the staff is. She tries to offhandedly apologize just so we leave, and when we don't, because we want a genuine response, she accuses us of harassing the staff.. When we remind her we are just stating facts and filing a complaint, and that we were paying customers, she goes, "Not anymore."

I'm sorry, what? You're trying to tell us we're not customers? It's one thing if we were punching people at the bar; it's another to just be stating the obvious: don't treat your customers like crap for no reason, and especially not if you're not doing that to everyone. Hello, that's discrimination. Tired of [white] people looking so shocked when you say they're exhibiting that; just because you don't think you're 'racist,' doesn't mean your actions aren't reflecting and upholding that very definition. 

Overall, extremely unprofessional and unpleasant experience. As someone who just moved over here, I didn't expect this. In New York, people who are rude are rude to everyone. It disgusts me that some people in SF are so oblivious to the lack of diversity and apparent ongoing discrimination that takes place every weekend in the Marina. Time to finally take responsibility for what you are or what you stand for, and stop making excuses.
author: Maggie S.

description: Best Bar in town. If you want to know the old school real SF people. This is the place. Your always welcome at Mauna Loa as long as your nice.
author: Matt B.

description:
By far my favorite bar in the Marina. I don't spend much time in the Marina, I find a lot of the restaurants/bars to be a bit overrated, packed, and just boring for my taste, but Mauna Loa Club is a nice diamond in the ruff.

Located on the corner of Fillmore and Union, Mauna Loa doesn't look like much from the outside but step inside/step back in time to this cozy, unassuming and comfortable bar. A nice selection of beers on tap with prices from $5-$7 and also serving up a full bar with plenty of liquor and spirit options.  The bartenders here are great. I have never had to wait more than 30 seconds for them to greet me, they are quick to take your order, friendly and willing to answer any questions about styles of beers/offer a taste. 

I had one particularly great night here on New Years Eve 2015. Not really the spot that screams NYE but my boyfriend and I were walking around town and wanted somewhere low key to grab a quick beer that wouldn't be too crowded.  Spent a little while at Mauna Loa chatting with the bartenders and other patrons. At one point the owner came in and bought the whole bar a round of drinks - wooo! cheers to that. Since then, this place has had a little space in my heart for a welcoming bar that really cares about the customers and gives quality service. 

Also, a great patio in the back, only open two times a year (once for the Union street festival - not sure about the other time?) and BRING CASH!
author: Kelsey B.

description: Went in for a beer and some games on a quite, uneventful Wednesday... as an industry bartender of 10 years and a neighbor of the area, I was appalled and disgusted with the rude female bartender working last night. this isn't the first time this individual has been rude and grumpy for no reason... might be time for a career change honey, it's called the service Industry for a reason, and clearly you hate your job. If this individual is behind the bar I will avoid this establishment at all costs and take my business elsewhere... definitely no longer recommending this place to my patrons and regulars at my bars due to this terrible service and unnecessary treatment. As businesses owners I'd recommend cleaning up your staff and remind your bartender that being in the service industry means being friendly and knowing how to serve. Such a shame!
author: Meg D.

description: Cute little bar with tiki drinks for under $10. (Where can you find drinks for under $10 these days?) They have some arcade games and even a nice little outdoor area in the back! A nice casual spot for when you don't feel like being all bougie. Only gotcha: cash only!
author: Davis K.

description: This is a great neighborhood bar with reasonable drink prices, friendly staff, sports on tv, a constant stream of people changing up the vibe. Being from Chicago, I can truly appreciate the corner bar feel of Muana Loa...
author: Charles L.

description: First time coming yesterday, and it was great to grab a table and play cards, provided by the bar tender. They also have a pool table, arcade games, basketball game. The atmosphere is wonderful, down-to-earth fun. TVs were playing the exciting football game. Even a regular, a dog, saddled up to the counter and asked for his special treat, and the bartender was quick to oblige! This is one cool bar. Don't miss it!
author: Kiera R.

description: Great bartenders- cool atmosphere in the best neighborhood in the city!! I think we tipped em like 35 bucks, - The drinks were typical dive bar style, nothin wrong with that,
author: Josie W.

description:
Fillmore Street, one of my go to places on a Satruday or Sunday night. Went there yesterday, on a Thursday night to look for a fun place to have a few drinks but most places were relatively dead. We ended up hanging out at Mauna Loa Club for a a while, having some beers and playing pool. 

Mauna Loa Club, located at the corner of Union and Fillmore, is your classic dive bar. With pool tables, arcade games (if I remember correctly ?!) and cheap drinks. The wooden decor and chill vibe was unexpected as we made our way along Fillmore Street, as many of the bars and restaurants around there are more upscale. Mauna Loa was a welcome addition to our Thursday night bar hopping expedition. We played some pool, choose some songs on the jukebox and had an all around good time.
author: Aletta B.

description: Great place to be harassed and groped by creepy old men who won't get kicked out by the bouncer.
author: Asha J.

description: Cole slaw is very good and waiters are extremely friendly. I would recommend the chicken Katsu, BBQ chicken, short ribs, or poke. Have never been disappointed here and keep coming back. Reasonable prices and quick service too!  The combos are also a great option if you want to try a little of everything.
author: Frances H.

description:
Short and sweet. 

A dive bar in the Marina.

A much needed breath of fresh air to the douchebaggery that oozes through the streets of this neighborhood.

Cheap(er) drinks than their nearby "competition."

Those draaaaanks... they're stiff. No measuring here.

Shoot some hoops, it's okay.

Grab a seat, there's usually plenty to go around.

Great juke but the price per song is a bit steep.

Wear your Hawaiian shirt, you'll be fine.
author: Brad B.

description: Appropriate dive bar to grab a pineapple vodka! Enjoyable wasn't too packed and service was prompt. Aloha!
author: J K.

description:
Manua Loa will always have a special place in my heart. The majority of my 20's were spent in this bar, leaving me with great memories, good friends, and lots of hang overs. To be honest there were a few bad experience that translated into great stories I could share with my friends over a drink or two.  

Drinks are cheat, bar is cash only, and they have Pop-o-Shot! 

The personalities of the bartenders vary greatly but this a good thing, keeps it interesting.  

If you are lucky you can snag the best seat in the house (Corner of the bar, next to the window) and people watch.
author: Jen B.

description:
Nice water hole in the the marina! First things first, this place is cash only!!! Take out some cash and come party!!!

Lost of draft beers including alagash white which is not on tap may places around here! 

Lots of TVs and a pool table make for a great time. Come here for day drinks, friendly bar staff, and a great vibe.
author: Kristin F.

description: Great dive bar amidst a whole neighborhood of douchey marina bars. This place has great specials, fun bar games, plenty of seating and standing room, and a pleasant attitude that welcomes all patrons. A nice change from the high maintenance bars around the area, a refreshing dose of normal in a sea of crap.
author: Mike S.

description:
Casual, cash bar. A few surf boards and turtle shells..  but hey, you saw the name what were you expecting?

Very friendly staff and in looking around this place is pretty big. 

Tv's friendly talk, great drinks and a few specials....toss in a decent happy hour....worth the visit.
author: Dan A.

description: Simply put if you as a customer feel like you're an inconvenience to the bartender at a bar you're in the wrong place....or the bartender is in the wrong profession. The place is ok but the dark haired female bartender this Saturday afternoon was let's say less than. Customer service professionals that are rude are bad for business and not professionals
author: Robert H.

description: Great bar. Cash only. Friendly bartender- possibly owner- Curt? Happy hour $5 well drinks and draft beers with a solid selection.  Clean bar, good drinks, solid specials, and the best 90s music. We met some of the best people here and I'd love to come back.
author: Gina R.

description: I love a great dive bar but you know what I love more? A dive bar that carries good wine . Mauna Loa doesn't carry a lot of wine but they carry good wine including a rose. Who would have known? Not me if Cyna, the rockstar, bartender didn't tell me. See ya next Saturday afternoon dearest! You made my Saturday fantastic!
author: paulina k.

description: The go-to spot in the Marina for a chill/fun night.  Pop a shot + juke box to play your own songs + tvs + cheap drinks + chill atmosphere...what more could you want in a local bar?!?
author: Faith B.

description: Fun, friendly, relaxing night. Love the beer selection and ease of hanging out. Great "local" (even if I'm not a local). Sculpin a current favorite. Don't forget, cash only.
author: Dredge E.

description:
A friend reccomended I try this marina bar. I'm not in the marina a lot because I really don't care for most of the places up there to drink. However, I'm glad to know this place is there.
I love dive bars, I love beer and I love games. I was very pleased with the pricing here and the service. Happy hour is a great deal and the bartender there is awesome! Cina always remembers what we ordered and remembers my husband and I too when we come in. People like that make me feel at home and keep me coming back. Cheers!
author: Bibi B.

description:
Dear Mauna Loa,

I really try to like you. I've been here multiple times. You're pretty close to my workplace. You're a quirky looking Hawaiian Bar in the Marina. You claim to be a Dive. I really want to like you, but you make it very hard. 

Mauna Loa is disappointing. It claims to be a dive bar but doesn't have a real happy hour. Last time I was there, I was charged $11 for a Dark and Stormy at 5:30 pm! ($9 for the Meyer's Rum, and get this: $2 for the ginger beer)  Now, I don't want to boast, but I've drank in bars ALL around the city and charging for a mixer when you've already charged for a hard liquor is unheard of. It wasn't even a generous pour... not cool! 

And a cash only dive bar? In the Marina? That charges the same prices as a nice SOMA bar for a simple drink? No thanks! 

It's usually pretty quiet on weeknights at happy hour time. Your usual middle-aged daytime drinkers (What do they do all day??), or your extra loud, mostly white, Marina crowd. 

I would tell you to skip it, but if you're constrained to that neighborhood, there aren't too many better places to skip it to! 

SOLID 2 STARS.
author: Krithika H.

description: Love this bar!  Friendly staff, good drinks, good company.  A solid neighborhood bar where you can relax and enjoy some sports or music on the juke box.  I'll be a customer for years to come!  Thanks Mauna Loa!!!
author: Graham D.

description:
As far as dive bars go, it's hard to give them 4 stars. It's difficult to find a place worthy that rating.

Mauna Loa Club is definitely a fun place to hang out with a variety of games such as basketball, foosball, pool, etc... Even more fun when you've been drinking! For people from LA visiting SF, this is pretty much like a Busby's without the dance floor.

I came here around 11pm on a Friday night and it was packed! It was packed like sardines. Despite the number of the people in the bar, it was very easy and quick to get a round. 

They have drink specials, so you can get pretty torn up here.

CASH ONLY.
author: James B.

description:
Witnessed their bouncers trying to KILL some kid tonight.  

The short portly/fat 45ish looking white guys with soft facial features and salt and pepper hair were out for blood...

Pile drived this guys head on public property after my friends and I had helped to establish about 10 ft of space OUTSIDE the bar and the situation was essentially diffused.  VIGILANTE BULL SHI*.

My friend got an MMA elbow to the jaw from the bouncer for his efforts at peace.  Other guy with huge nose who was getting free drinks (and likely on the payroll) came out and kicked the guy in the head and tried to fight me too. COWARDLY. COWARDS. 

Police report and lawsuit are pending.

PLEASE.  DO NOT GO HERE. THIS IS A MORAL ISSUE.
THEY TRY TO KILL THEIR PATRONS WITH GANG HEAD KICKS.

I WAS APPALLED BY THE INTENT TO KILL.


THE OWNER SENT THE CRIMiNAL BOuncers home to protect them. THe owner would not discuss the injury to my friend even though they were on the premises. They claimed the instagator ( who they tried to kill with head kicks) was on PCP ?!? I saw him and that is complete BS.
author: Brian M.

description:
There are several reasons I like this bar:

1. Pool Table that is actually available to play on! $1/game.
2. Juke box - $1/song
3. Reasonably priced drinks
4. Strong drinks
5. Not overly crowded
6. Available seating

Mauna Loa Club, you're alright!
author: Junel S.

description: Great to grab a beer and play some pool.
author: Peggy M.

description:
To be completely honest, the only reason that I'm writing a review is to create a list of places that have Big Buck Hunter...which this place has. They have Buck Hunter HD Online (2nd newest one and definitely one of the hardest). As of August 15 the 1st player (orange) gun is off by about an inch to the left and a half down. You might think its picky, but trust me you need it in order to get the big points by shooting far targets, and making sure your shots count. 

The bar is fine, drinks are normal priced. the regulars are cool, the kids that come in for large groups are not and give off a bitchy vibe. Not the place's fault, but it is what it is. Nice selection of beer, and they have Mexican beers.
author: Susie S.

description:
when i moved to SF in 1990, this was my first bar i ever went to.  back again for a couple of beers last night.  

The Good:

Pretty Girls
Great Hoop Shoot in the Back - aim the the backboard area right approve the rim - only way to fleece your friends.
Cold Beer
Good Tunes

The Bad:

None - It is a dive bar - don't be an elitist.  Great place.  Go and enjoy.
author: Allan B.

description:
I've been here twice now- both times with an entourage of female friends. 

Things I don't like:

1) Cash only bar. Come on guys. Get with the times.
2) Awkward women's restroom with only one stall.
3) Drinks of disproportionate proportions. 

Things I do like:

1) Pool table and other random games.
2) Music selection
3) General crowd this place draws. Its usually rather eclectic.

I'd venture back, but wouldn't be bummed if I didn't see if for awhile!
author: Annalise F.

description:
I guess I would consider myself a regular at Mauna Loa. Its prime location in between the Marina and Pac Heights make it ideal for a night of fun bar-hopping.

I don't know what the deal is with recent reviews talking about some fight that happened here recently, I wasn't even aware that this place had a bouncer. I've never been asked to show ID at the door or anything. Anyways . . . 

Pros: friendly bartenders, good drinks, a juke box that plays all your favorite hits (from "Call Me Maybe" to "Gangsta's Paradise"), a foosball table, and other arcade games in the back. 

Cons: Cash only bar. I mean, it's 2012, and I hate going to bars that only accept cash because let's face it, carrying $60+ with you when you go out is kinda a drag especially when you want to reserve that cash for other emergent necessities like taking your crew to follow that group of cute boys heading to bar across town or for your cab ride home. 

But with all that said, I keep coming back for the Jon Dalys and for the awesome bartender who gave us $5 to pump some jams on the jukebox that one time.
author: Linna L.

description:
I kind of thought that Mauna Loa would have crazy specialty cocktails, or at least rum drinks on special, but it's more of a dive bar.

It's full of wood and regulars. People that drink draft beers and easy shots. Friendly people playing pool, foosball or arcade basketball in the back. And sometimes there is that one guy or gal that started drinking way too early and is either having a hard time staying on the stool or controlling their inside voice volume.

It's not a regular destination for me per se, but I have to admit I do enjoy my drinks there whenever I stop in and for that it's A-OK with me.
author: Tiffany N.

description: This is one of those places that really isn't worth going to. Not only are the staff rude bros who wear backwards caps like lame '90s try-hard skater kids, they also aggressively encourage you to buy last drinks and proceed to turn on the lights and physically push you out when you have over half a beer left less than 10 minutes later. This is an irresponsible service of alcohol that should not be tolerated. I hope this bar soon goes into administration. I will then buy it and fire the wanker wearing the lame backwards cap.
author: Jackson S.

description:
I had a really great experience and time at Mauna Loa the other Sunday (funday). Basically, the bar transformed into a country fest! Somehow, the bar seemed to bring together so many of SF country music fans. They have a great, huge, high-tech touchscreen juke box machine that also let's you play games, post photos, etc. We put in money (it's not super cheap though) and started selected country songs and then about 5 others followed suit. Soon the whole bar was chatting about their fave country music tunes and singing along to the music. 

Meanwhile, we also played pool, shot hoops at pop-a-shot, and enjoyed $3 well drinks (rum & pineapple juice = so yummy even when the rum is a well!). Such a great, chill bar... with country music too! :)
author: Meghan P.

description: Classic dive. Cash only, haggard bathroom and a solid good time.
author: Ashley S.

description:
3.5 
4th star simply because the bartenders are cool as hell and they have a modern jukebox with a crowd that seriously likes new country.  If a place has folks that dig Jason Aldean and Luke Perry while drinking beer and no shee-shee drinks, AND there's a hoops in the back?!  Count me in when I am in that kinda mood.
author: Athena S.

description:
I found my dive bar.  This is it.  Cash only is the only down side.  But overall a good dive bar and games for your sober friends or DD, too.  

Love the basketball, bowling, foosball, pool and  games all over the place.  Paid $5 for shock top.  Not too shabby.  I could picture myself frequenting this place a lot.  

A bit of a sausage-fest, more than I'm used too with about a guy/girl ratio of 15:1 but that is just a downside for the guys I guess. The handful of girls that were there were girls there were with a boyfriend or with a large group of guys.  If you are looking for a dudes night out, or a place to NOT find large groups of women, this would be a good choice.
author: Hazel K.

description:
Curt and Tammi are unreal as true representatives of this place. Wow this is my first time here and the warmth of this place is inexplicable. I appreciate that it is clear up front it's cash only and there is no question.

Ok and.... Amazing red wine!!!!
author: mary helen d.

description: Marina dive bar. They have some old school bar games like one of those hockey tables and such. Can have a good crowd. No dance floor.
author: Michael C.

description:
I came here last night with some friends. The general consensus was to try to avoid the d-bagginess of some of the other places in the Marina. What we got instead of expensive and high class d-bagginess was instead a cheap substitute. Not sure I'd particularly recommend this place to anyone. There are divier places of greater repute if you're looking for a dive, and there are definitely much nicer places for anything else.

A "dive bar" feel, but not quite the real deal. I should know - I've spent thousands of dollars on research over the years.

Bartenders had the dive bar attitude down, including the ability to ignore me for 10 minutes twice in a row, even to the point that they took out the lemons, the knife, and the cutting board to do prep work before acknowledging me. It's alright, it's cool; I can wait. I'm a try-sexual. I'll try any place once. But lose my business as an establishment that serves alcohol and you are losing one heck of a devoted customer; I have true staying power when it comes to alcohol and would be a friend for life getting my drinkie-poo on.

Hate to rain on the dive bar parade, but the next time I want to be ignored by bartenders, then here are my requirements: I want the tattoos to be prison style, not fashion, and I want the contempt to be earned, not just thrown out there like a general M.O. I'll take my chances at the dive bars on 6th Street/Folsom area, Mission, or Richmond any day, and be glad to wait 20 minutes to order my $5 beer.

[Boo hiss scratch, yes, I am an angry kitten right now].
author: Anna S.

description: They're cash only, and their ATM doesn't work. They want me to go across the street to get cash instead of accepting my credit card. No thanks. I'll give my money to someone who provides customer convenience. They don't care about you here.
author: Adam S.

description:
What an awesome place!!! 

I am writing about a month late but still I can remember the bar that started my great night. Came through here to have my first round of beers after I spent a day of shopping in union area. Only a few people eating and having a beer at around 4 pm. I think what I just liked was that it's your average neighborhood bar. I wish I was living in this area to come here more often!
author: Ezequiel R.

description:
If you're looking for a place to play pool, play video hunting, and shoot basketball arcade this is an okay play to do so. If you're looking for a place to have good drinks, this is NOT the place. Even with such great prices, its not worth coming here, if you're looking for drinks. There are plenty of other bars very close by you may want to check out, just  heads

Water down drinks.
author: Isiah B.

description:
Went to this bar on a Saturday night and wasn't allowed in because the bouncer said my id was a fake. Wouldn't even look at my credit card for verification of my identity. I'm 25 years old. 

Lost any business from me, which granted I am only one customer, but I don't understand a business that doesn't seem to care at all. I wasn't unruly or belligerent to the bouncer, I just wanted to check out a bar that I'd heard was fun.
author: Shannon R.

description:
Dear bartender Jen-

I know that you think that because you are a bartender that you are a hot shot.... actually I won't even act like i know what you think. I do I know what I think and I DON'T think that makes you a hot shot!

Being rude to your customers is NOT how to bring business in and I found you to be rude, slow, and have terrible customer service.  Try to smile... maybe that help.  Try saying goodbye when someone says goodbye to you.  Try being polite when someone tries to engage in a conversation with you.

The bar itself is a great little dive bar.  Pool, TVs, booze!  Everything that you need and want in a dive bar.  We went on a Wednesday so it was the perfect amount of people.  Friendly people to play pool with and make new friends.

HOWEVER, if the girl behind the bar is Jen... I'm out.
author: Sarah W.

description:
Friendly bar-staff. Strong, Cheap Drinks. Dirty Bathroom.

Your typical dive-bar.
author: Helen D.

description: Cool place in the Marina.  Small.  You can play pool for awhile, but eventually it will be way too full.  They've got some other games on, as well.  A fun place to hang out and chat.  It gets HOT, though, when it's full...
author: Brian B.

description: Calling it a club is being generous. This is a very cool dive bar, however. It's a little like Bar None just a few blocks away in that it has a lot if games and a good beer selection.
author: Zach H.

description:
I hadn't been to Mauna Loa since..holy crap my review back in 2007?!?!?!

WELL.

It is still my favorite "dive" bar in the Marina. ML is always laid back, has a good happy hour, and the crowd is less obnoxious than any other bar especially on a Friday night. Well, let me rephrase, the local crowd is less obnoxious, but the out of towner B&T crowd who managed to find this gem last Friday really should have taken the cues from the locals who rolled our eyes at the sad attempt at rapping to the jukebox and dancing with flailing limbs.

But, the fact that most people just stayed away from these buffoons goes to show that the ML crowd tends to not get caught up in the drama and lets people who need to scream and make asshats of themselves do their thing and leave. 

Bartenders were fast and friendly as always. Although minus 1 star for the barback who continued to knock into me and hit me in the back with a box of beer. A simple "please excuse me" would have saved me the bruises.
author: Kathy K.

description:
Lots of games (bball, foosball, pool)..but the cherry on the top was definitely the complimentary goldfish crackers for me! Tastes of childhood in between sips of [hopefully not childhood] alcohol! 

....Evidently, I still am a "child" in some respects (Admit it! You are too...)
author: G L.

description:
This is a Marina bar that's a little more my style. Though the male to female ratio seems to be heavily skewed, like many places in the neighborhood, there's thankfully plenty of stools, little corners you can claim for your group, all while you drink, laugh and bask in the mildly kitschy tiki and somewhat random decor of this odd bar.

Not only do they have 10+ affordable beers on tap (quite impressive for the size of the place) including PBR, Blue Moon, Trumer Pils, Lost Coast Great White Ale and others, but they also have pool, foosball, that hunting video game and arcade basketball. The music was fun 80s tunes and everyone always seems to be having a good time. This is one of the first Marina bars I've been to where I haven't had to battle high maintenance blondes with oversized Gucci hobo bags and belligerent jock types at the bar to get a drink. Bummer it's cash only. Fun bar, nonetheless.
author: Chelsea P.

description:
Probably the only bar in the area that I wouldn't mind coming back to again. It's dive-y, and the decor doesn't match the theme really- it's a Hawaiian bar but with no real Hawaiian touches but I still really liked it. They have two bars and plenty of space so it didn't feel crowded- it was pretty crowded but I could actually sit at the smaller second bar comfortably and have a conversation at close to normal sound level. 

The second bar is cash only but that's really not a big deal. Their ATM charges less than two bucks!! Outside of New Orleans I haven't seen one that cheap. I have no idea why they just don't change the name of the bar to 'Our ATM charges less than two dollars' I think it would draw a lot of people in. They also have absinthe and absinthe cocktails- I didn't partake this time but I am impressed and amazed that a place carries it-what with the stigma and all. A definite 3.5 and a guaranteed return visit from me if/when I return to the San Francisco area.
author: Ted C.

description:
Pro: Foosball Table and Basketball Nets at the back of the bar
Con: Creepy Marina boys hitting on you

Pro: Fairly Cheap Drinks
Con: Bathroom is tiny and gross.

Pro: Bartenders get drunk while pouring and don't add your bill up correctly.
Con: Cash only

Pro: Lost my wallet there one night and they found it for me
Con: Crowd often reminds me of the old fraternity parties in college

Overall, the Loa is good for a quick drink on your way to somewhere else or as a last stop. But, if you're staying in Pac Heights that night, take a cab up that 3 block hill because Fillmore after a night at the Loa is like climbing Mt. Everest! Trust me, I've been there...3 inch heels and all.
author: Nam N.

description:
12.18.10

Mauna Loa.  What you would think an awesome fraternity house would be.  Packed into a tiny bar.

Foosball?  Check
Basketball?  Check
Big Buck Hunter?  Check
Pool table?  Check

Bars in the front and the back.  Dark, loud and grimy.

Exactly what you'd expect at a frat house.
author: Jenny L.

description: Solid dive bar in the marina. Spent a couple hours in the black playing foosball and watching the guys shoot hoops.
author: Ally T.

description: This is a great little bar in the Marina. The staff is super friendly, and they have fun games in the back to play! This place is cash only, but they have an ATM inside!
author: Stephanie T.

description: This place is garbage. It's stinky and the people are rude. Waste of time with so many better options nearby.
author: Omar C.

description:
Let me preface my low two-star rating by saying that I like dive bars, and I'm not anti-Marina. I have a lot of fun in this area when I'm in the mood. 

However, this is a place I would not be excited to come back to--at least on a Saturday night, when I first visited.

Cash only bar... okay, sure, authentic dive, but super annoying especially if you're worried about having cash to get a cab home and the ATM is out of order (it was).

Secondly, it was HOT in there. As in, I was sweating just standing there and not in a sea of sweating frat boys either!

The drink I had (cocktail) was tiny, could barely taste the booze and was overpriced.

It's cool that they have games, for sure, but on Saturday night it almost made it worse because it was so crowded and I kept almost getting my eye poked out with a pool cue.

I do like the wood dive bar feel so maybe this place would be great for happy hour. But it didn't impress me.
author: Courtney A.

description: It's the Marina, but it doesn't feel as "Marina-ey" inside this dive bar. It's got open space and a good flow and when I went, it had a cool mix of people. Drinks were  fairly priced-- just keep in mind that it's cash only! Also, the bouncer Claudio was a super sweet heart. He was super helpful with directions and making our group feel very welcome when we came in!
author: Courteney K.

description:
What's with the fucking attitude, people?!?   Ok I get that this is a neighborhood dive bar and clearly everyone here knows everybody else and you're all chum and all, but if we walk into your establishment, the least we could expect is a friendly word from the bartender.   If the regulars wish to ostracize us, so be it, but the fucking bartender?  We pay your salary you dumb prick!   And what's with the look, huh?  Are you going for the Bob Ross "Joy of Painting" lookalike contest?

He didn't really fuck up my drink, since I got a Bushmills on ice, but my wife said that her vodka Sprite sucked ass.   We promptly finished our drinks and exited the establishment.   Thankfully we cruised down to the Balboa to salvage the night, but I agree with Uli's review...  The vibe here was full on Fear & Loathing.
author: David O.

description:
Marina friend #1: Dude, let's go to Mauna Loa
Me: Ah, fu**, you KNOW I don't like the Marina. 

Seriously, the fact that this place is across the street from Matric Fillmore almost made me puke, but I ate my words and had fun. 

It was more of a divey sports bar in the marina (err, "cow hollow").

I think what put it over the top for me was the chill crowd (ie: not douchebag-filled) and the mini basketball machine in the back. I could spend hours on that thing accepting challenges from strangers. Add beer to that endeavor and you've got yourself an evening.
author: Carlos A.

description:
What a disappointment and a letdown after starting so good.

On the fable Goth Night at the Marina, a crowd of Goth gitup of SF & LA Yelpers do a barhop from one corner to another. It started up very promising with Circa and Kelly's Tavern. Then it went to a thundering thud of Matrix Filmore. We should stop there, but we decided to roll that dice.

It went crashing into smithereens with this one.

Mauna Loa is a very confusing place to be in. It had couple of games in the back like a strip down version of Dave & Buster's. A pool table on the side that people kept interrupting by bumping into the poor game. Last, but not least... a jukebox. 

It's great if you are looking to chill and have fun, but it seemed to get the overcrowd fallout from Matrix Filmore and stuff the place to a tilt. Not very appealing place to be as it get crowded. You need to be constantly moving to avoid standing in people's way.

It has the look of a dive bar if the price of the drinks matches it. Alas, it's a crowded bar that is no better than a poor man version of Hooters.
author: Mike L.

description:
As far as dive bars go, Mauna Loa does it pretty well. Its got the creeky old wood floors, the lighting and the smell that one would expect of any respectable dive. That being said, its nothing to go out of the way for, however, if I end up at Mauna Loa somewhere along the way its always proved to be a good time.

Pros: two bars (a main one in the front, and one in the back that is open on the weekends after 9pm). A jukebox thats always playing singable hits. A pool table, basketball game, buckhunter, and other retro video games in the back. A good mix of people looking for a fun night. Oh, and the prices are reasonable too.

Cons: Cash only and it can get hot when its crowded
author: Krista S.

description:
This place is cool!!

It is a great mid-week place to meet friends for some fun activities. It has foosball, basketball, Big Buck Hunter, and a pool table. Pool is even free on a Monday!!

Behind the bar there are dice for some liars dice! $1 a game keeps it interesting... I even won my first ever game :)

The beer is reasonable prices and a good selection.
author: Chris M.

description: The latina girl bartender is really mean.  She should be fired immediately.  She is literally driving people out of the bar with her nasty attitude.
author: Chris S.

description: Didn't think I'd find a place like this in the Marina. Reminds me of the dive bars in my small Ohio college town. Went on a Monday and Tammy came up and told us that she cooks a free dinner every Monday! Brats and sauerkraut last night, pulled pork next Monday! Don't pass this place up!
author: Audrey H.

description:
BEST DIVE BAR IN THE MARINA!!!

Big Buck Hunter, Basketball Shootout, awesome jukebox, and pool table - what more could you want from a great dive!?! It's dark and just gives off the dive bar vibe!

They've got good beer on tap (and they're reasonably priced), they pour heavy shots and the bartenders are sassy and witty!

Others may complain about the frat boys/d-bags that frequent Mauna Loa's, but what do you expect in the Marina District? They're easy to ignore when you're partaking in a game of Big Buck Hunter or pool... or just make sure to avoid this place on a Friday or Saturday night (or pre-funk here before it gets crowded).

This is a CASH only place, so either bring some skrilla or hit up the ATM machine between the Men's bathroom & the Buck Hunter machine!!!
author: Christine Z.

description:
Hazel K., a San Francisco local, brought me and some friends here during a weekend visit because it is her favorite bar in the city. After one visit, I can see why one would frequent this place often. It's a very mellow dive bar where the music is played at a tolerable volume, and conversations are possible. It seems it does get crowded on the weekends, but people don't hog bar-space so it's actually quite easy to get to a bartender and order a round. There is one of those basketball shooting games, a pool table, foosball table, some bowling game, and the bartenders have dice for dicey games.

Also, everyone was very friendly! Strangers got in on our basketball competitions and challenged us to games of pool. As far as I could tell, at least with the people I encountered, it was not a douchey crowd. Overall, a good time was had here.

Like others have mentioned, cash only.
author: Amie G.

description:
Cool place. Very stereotypical Marina dive bar :)

Cheap drinks, fun people, fun games. 

They make a nice vodka soda! Definitely dont skimp on the vodka.
author: M M.

description: I have never been more confused or mortified before than Curt made me feel here.  I came to Mauna Loa after the 49er game to have a drink with my friend for his birthday.  I didn't realize that Manua Loa was cash only so when we showed up, I took $80 out of their ATM.  What happened next was ridiculous . . . I asked the bartender for 2 Bud Lights and a glass of water for my friend.  I handed him a $20 and after he gave me the beers, he had $1 in his hand.  He told me that I gave him $1 and that wasn't enough.  I explained that I had given him $20 because I had used their ATM and my boyfriend was holding the $60.  He told me that he hadn't opened the register and I was wrong.  I said that there must be a misunderstanding and started looking on the bar and floor for the $20.  I asked him to look on his side of the bar for the $20.  He then dismissed me and told me that I was drunk and since I was making a big deal of it, that he would give me the drinks for free.  I called my boyfriend over and told him what was going on.  He explained to Curt that we didn't have any cash so there was no way I could have given him $1 and that we weren't drunk since we just got there.  In between all of us, Curt was drinking beers and taking shots with the people next to us.  He then proceeded to call us drunk assholes - we then spotted our $20 sitting next to the register.  When we told him that we thought our $20 was right there, he told us that he was going to call the cops and to get out of his bar.  My boyfriend tried to reason with him which wasn't worth it.  We left the untouched beers on the counter and walked out.  I have never had a bar experience like that before and couldn't believe how he was yelling at me when I tried to reason with him.  I was polite and trying to find the missing $20 but he wasn't interested.  I can afford $20 so I hope he enjoys the tip but I won't ever go there again.
author: Arica V.

description:
I have been coming here for awhile now; and love this dive bar. At this cash only bar - the drinks are fairly cheap and there a ton of games to play from foosball, basketball, Big Buck Hunter, and a pool table with a bar in both the front and back of the town.

Typically, I have come on both a Saturday and Sunday, and neither day have been over-ally crowded to the point of where it's unable to have a conversation or enjoy yourself.
author: Brian D.

description:
I would have upped the star factor if the place did not smell like a dirty diaper. 
 We went on a Thursday and it was pretty full, with Journey blasting and the people next to me chowing on a fresh pizza I wanted a beer bad! The bartenders were friendly and poured a fat drink for my friend, so she was really happy. 
 The people seemed frat-like but really friendly and jovial, not asshole frat-like. They had a a few pool tables and games on the side wall, the music was good in the Juke which was good. But Journey was being played an awful lot. 
 It is a dive bar, but was a fun experience, except for that smell. We could not figure it out and had to leave after a few drinks. 
 Whew out into the city night...
author: Emily L.

description:
I like this bar--pop-a-shot is awesome and prices are reasonable.  Normally I think I would've given a 3 star bc its just a fun bar.  Not really 4 stars but not a great place.  HOWEVER, I just was there last night.  And unfortunately I believe my phone was stolen (literally hours before my 28th birthday).  The staff was super helpful and sympathetic.  Still no phone but the sentiment was helpful!  Thank you!

Beware of pick-purses...ugh just watch your purses ladies.  The gal literally snatched my phone while my purse was on my person!
author: Angela S.

description:
A good friend of mine who is a local took me to this bar. First thing to know this is a cash only bar, which I find only adds to the total experience (Norm never paid with plastic). If you are looking for umbrella drinks, coat checks and a chance to show your Amex Black card this is not for you. But if you appreciate a real neighborhood style bar were people know your name and you can have a discussion the current hot topic or just about really good Micro Brews this would be the spot. The owner is an outstanding individual and great to carry on a discussion with. 

The beer selection is great the variety will truly be appreciated by any micro brew fan. The only miss is no Galaga so I could stomp my buddy once and for all in our bar decathlon.   :o
author: Jake B.

description: Another great place to hang out and watch a Giants or 49er game. It is however a bit small for the size of crowds that it gets, in other words don't wear your good shoes as your feet will get stepped on. You can tell that the bartenders and barbacks have their favourite customers, but that's the name of the game eh, get those tips anyway that you can. All in all I do like this place from time to time.
author: Henry F.

description:
It is unfortunate that an established bar such as Mauna Loa has such an attitude. I was there tonight with roughly 20 friends. We were in the back of the bar next to the basketball hoop game. 

The back of the bar has only one female bartender who left her post for 20 minutes on a busy Friday night leaving a crowd of thirsty customers.

Since the bartender was missing, my friend reached over the bar to refill her water.  It was then that the bartender's boyfriend (who looked like he had just stepped out of Long Beach circa 1990 with a flipped up black billed cap and dark plastic rimmed glasses) stepped behind the bar and ripped the water gun out of my friend's hand. 

He proceeded to cuss us out, and then tapped off his beer! 

When the bartender returned, her boyfriend whispered in her ear what had just happened. She stared at us with daggers in her eyes and proceeded to cuss us out. 

Mind you ... we only wanted some water; and she was the one who left her post on a busy Friday night. 

I am extremely disappointed at the Mauna Loa's poor service and lame attitude.  My friends and I will find a NEW local hangout.
author: Kate F.

description: Great bar in the Marina that doesn't have the typical Marina crowd all the time.  Good selection of beers on tap at normal pint prices.  Has a pool table, buckshot, foosball, and basketball game.  Check out the small bar in the back, wait is normally shorter than the one up front.  Can get loud easily between the people and music, so recommended for a rowdy night out with a group.  Cash only which is a bummer but not a deal breaker.
author: Tristan Z.

description: I love this place! It's a much appreciated respite from the string of clubby/fratty places on this street. Bartender is always friendly and helpful and the selection isn't vast, but atmosphere is so charming and chill. A nice change of pace here.
author: Lauren C.

description: Used to come here all the time when I was younger. Very typical Marina place, Good place to meet girls and chug beers. The one drawback was when I had to take a big shit in the bathroom. There is no stall in the men's room, meaning there are a couple urinals and a toilet. While on the toilet, people kept coming and going from the bathroom, opening the door and exposing me to everyone in the bar. They could clearly see me sitting/shitting on the toilet....
author: Jim B.

description: I love this place!  You can find me here on a weekly basis. Great bartenders, pop shot, and the new buck hunter. what more does a guy need?
author: Bryan C.

description:
*Shudders at the thought of being at this bar* 

I have found that most places in the Marina I actually like... Mauna Loa is not one of them... it is one of those places that makes me think.. YUP I'm in the Marina... AKA the place is full of Marina Douche bags 

Those overly annoying men who think they are super hot but really just make you vomit in your mouth a lil bit. And of course their snooty lady friends who look you up and down for wearing a sweatband.. whoops! 

In addition to the bad crowd, it was OVERLY crowded... and after 20 minutes of waiting by the bar for a beer I found myself feeling oddly claustrophobic. The games in the back are nice.. however there really isn't enough space for them... I wanted to flee this place like a Jew at a concentration camp... too soon????
author: Hailey P.

description:
This is one of those bars that you are always forced to goto even though you hate the place because your friends all go, or at least in my case. Here is how I break it down:

The goods:
-Close to other bars so you can leave quickly (haha)
-The bouncers, actually really mellow and non-intense, good guys.
-The basketball game/buckhunter

the bads:
-Cash only... WTF, who does that still?
-Awkward layout causes for no comfortable place to sit and constantly bumping into people, spilling drinks everywhere. So cramped that it makes it awkward having conversations or meeting people.
-Literally need a rape whistle or a set of tits to get a drink... the bartenders here are horribly slow and rude.

In general, this is just one of those places I have never really liked yet I find myself going every couple months, leaving with the same taste in my mouth. Hopefully my friends will come to the same conclusion I have...
author: Sam K.

description:
It's close - 5 stars

It's too expensive for it's own good - 4 stars

I suck at foosball - 3 stars

It's better on a weeknight, save yourself from the suburban crazies.
author: Jess S.

description:
Mauna Loa Club holds a special place in my heart because it was the first bar I went to the night I moved in. I didn't know anyone yet, but my brother's friend lived in the neighborhood and wanted to hang. She spent the whole night talking about how much she hated living in the Marina. Fail. 

Fast forward 3 years, I still love living in the Marina, but I usually come here on weeknights. It's not very crowded, which means no long lines at the bar or the teeny weeny bathroom and you can take full advantage of the GAMES! The basketball arcade game is my favorite. They've got pool and Foosball too. I just wish they took cards!
author: Kelly C.

description: It's a great place to start or end - they have pool, basketball, and foosball! It is a cash bar so be sure to hit up the ATM before coming. There is a fine beer selection and there is usually a drink special for the night - which is acceptable if you are planning on getting sugar sloshed. -1pt because the foosballs get stolen or lost and are not replaced, so you are paying 75 cents to play an incomplete game. It can also get really hot in the evenings because the backdoor is kept closed and there is otherwise no ventilation.
author: Don W.

description:
A ridiculous fight broke out there and I tried to help stop it. We separated the two people, but an old middle aged bouncer slumbered out and was really aggressive. Another middle aged bouncer and this crazy guy (probably the owner) charged out and started stomping one of the guys we had separated. I think he was only 21 or 22. They started stomping his head on the street and kicking him in the face. NOT COOL!!  
I couldn't believe it! I tried to get the bouncers off of the guy, because it looked like they were going to kill him. Then, the fat old bouncer turned around, looked at me with these crazy eyes, and started punching me in the face over and over again!! 
It was terrible! I was absolutely shocked!! After I took a small beating, I asked to speak to the manager or owner.  The perpetrators (bouncers) all left within minutes to cover their own asses, and not get arrested. The owner was there, but never came out to talk.
Anyways, a police report has been filed, and they have a BIG lawsuit on their hands. We were all off property. The middle aged bouncers instigated a relentless beating on someone I was not associated with, absolutely kicking the shit out of him on the curb and street. And then they came after me when I tried to calm them down. They hit me in the face and jaw several times. I never threw a punch. I tried to get him to stop hitting me, but he just kept going to town. Then, I tried to talk to them about it, and they blamed me for the entire incident....shoring up their story for the police. These bastards have to pay for this!
author: Jon J.

description:
Great place to go if you want to pick up underage girls or watch people throwing up in the corner.

It's a dive bar by Marina standards - a bunch of super young kids going out to get drunk and hook up, but in a non-dressy environment.

Also, they have deer hunter.
author: Bob R.

description:
Jesse on Tuesday night's is the best!!

We used to hang out here every Tuesday after work, play foos and basketball, and a little buck hunter. It is the divey-est of the marina bars - you don't have to deal with beer pong a-holes or blue light coronas.

One star off because Friday and Saturday nights get too crazy - can't say the crowd is really my style. If you bring along good company like we do, you won't notice the "marina" stereotypes as much.
author: Chelsea D.

description: So it doesn't feel Hawaiian/tropical at all despite the name, more like a marina dive bar that doesn't take cards. I've swung in here from time to time, either to find a crowd of boys who act much younger than 21, or single men older than my father posted up at the bar. Not my favorite spot in the marina, but at least there's foosball and games.
author: Kristin F.

description:
I have been here in the daytime, on a weekday, when it is virtually empty, and the place itself isn't half bad. The have pool and bar snacks. Not popcorn or pretzels but that mix stuff that you can pick through for your favorite things. I like the little sesame things so this makes me happy. They even have one of those silly basketball games in the back that I havent seen since the last time I was in a Chuckee Cheese. How often do you see that in a bar? The bartenders are down to earth and the place doesn't ooze pretentiousness as many of the Marina bars do. They have an open front window so you can enjoy the fresh air on a nice day. Daytime experience is a four star experience. 

Night time it goes downhill. They start doing specials at the back bar (there are two) with names like "tits and ass" that have the flavor of the latter. But, they are appealing to the Marina crowd. 

I have heard you are what you eat. Does that apply to drinks too?
author: Drue C.

description:
I don't know what to say about Mauna Loa. It's a cross between a dive bar, a tiki bar, a sports bar...

And it's in the Marina. 

WHAT ON EARTH do you say about that? 

A few things that deserve a mention, however:

They have foosball. And an internet jukebox. And the bartender is a very nice dude. However I don't know if he'll still be nice to me and my crew now that he's definitely uncovered the nasty heap of vomit we left outside the front door...

(It wasn't MINE, okay?)

We weren't trying to tell you anything, Mauna Loa! We actually had a good time with you and your foosball table! We were just metaphorically demonstrating our feelings about the MARINA... 

Get it? Vomiting on the Marina? It was a very calculated statement. Very punk rock.
author: Lisa T.

description:
This place has super ice melting powers.

The cubes in my drink melted in a matter of minutes.

Warm drink..bleh.

ALSO....

It smelled like ass in here.  

No joke.
author: Jay H.

description:
It's strange, when we headed over there after meeting up with our friends, I assumed that this place was Hawaiian themed ("Mauna Loa")  After going there, I have no clue if this place has anything to do with Hawaii.  It was ridiculously packed, and the guest demographic seemed to be current or former college frat members and ex-cheerleaders, all completely trashed.

There were absolutely no space for any of us to stand comfortably around the bar or pretty much the front 3/4 of the bar, so we headed on to the back of the bar, where we found some games, particularly foosball.  

My friend Ting is obsessed with foosball so she shrieked out of excitement when she found out that they had it.  We started playing within our group, and eventually were joined by a couple of guys that were really good at it.  Then we were ultimately taken over by another pair of guys that were REALLY good at it.  Like, did-you-play-this-game-every-day-through-4-years-of-college? good.  All strategic, passing the little ball between "players" in the same line, etc.  We were all quite impressed & were entertained being spectators at this point.

Anyway, to sum up my experience.... this bar is basically a rowdy guys/drunk girls' hang out.  Would I come here alone or with just a couple of girls? errrhhmm no... drinks weren't particularly impressive, the guys there are drunk and not particularly attractive so why go?  Would I go there with a bunch of co-ed friends when we are bar-hopping in the area? Sure, why not.  But I will go straight to the back of the bar around the foosball table lol.  If I were a single bachelor or just with a whole bunch of guys & want to get loud and hammered?  This place would be a great choice.
author: Sascha O.

description:
A dive bar in the Marina, that's funny.

I came here many moons ago and drove by it yesterday and realized I had never reviewed it. The one and only time I came here was when I didn't live here, which I think explains a lot because I now know better, but regardless, if you are stuck in the Marina and want a cheap drink in a divey sort of Hawaaian themed, Ventures kinda place and enjoy being surrounded by stripe shirt, buttoned down fashions, then this is as good a bet as any. 

Would I rush back here, haha, not likely, but they did have a fun digital jukebox and the bartender seemed nice enough. Terrible Blooy Mary though.
author: Stephy S.

description:
Recently, my friend and I were dragged to Mauna Loa by a pair of good-looking striped shirts. It seemed a little dank and overflowing with Marinaites, but a girl will support her sista if the hormones are a-blazin'. She wanted the tall guy with the pretty blue eyes. I got stuck with the somewhat shorter guy with the backwards baseball cap. She's 5'1 and I'm 6'1, go figure. I'll be her wingwoman anytime. 

Anyways, as it would turn out, the handsome guy was insufferably boring. Honestly, it's great that you went to a prestigious university and were in a top fraternity, blah blah blah, but I STILL don't care about your golf score. I lucked out, and HIS wingman, the guy with the baseball hat, turned out to be awesome. (Proof positive, gentlemen, that personality trumps looks EVERYTIME.) We bonded. He bought us a round of beer when he turned out to be the only one with cash in his wallet. Hell, my friend was jealous of me and the almost guaranteed good night I was to have. 

And then I was brought face to face with one of the Cardinal rules of drinking: Whenever a lady is having a fabulous drunkenly good time with a gentleman, one of them is gonna get too drunk to continue. Guess who that happened to?

"Um...I need to get outside and get some fresh air...I feel green." I announced to the group while we waited for the pool table to open. My friend, already looking for a clean break from Mr. Pretty-But-Boring, whisked me outside where I proceeded to pass out on the curb. The guys took this as a typical girl bailing because she's bored maneuver, and we never saw them again after I recovered. I wasn't lying, I swearrrrrrrrr. I really did feel sick. This bar was super super stuffy...no ventilation?

Still...good place for drinks when you haven't already knocked down 10 elsewhere. I especially enjoyed the bouncer who didn't card me after I turned the entry into a revolving door every three minutes, the party in the bathroom with the "French Doors," and the female patron in line that told me I looked like "that girl from Save the Last Dance...but without the frizzy hair."

And to the shorter guy who I deserted? Call me. Oh, you don't have my number? Just kidding, I guess something suddenly came up.
author: Devon S.

description:
Who wants to play a game of popshot -- it's a bball game not a porno yo!  
Not big on basketball, what about fussball?  They got that shi here too.

Deff not the greatest bar ever but it's a step up from KT's for shizzle.  It's an older frat scene.  A bit better then the lowest grade Marina.  But don't give Mauna Loa too much credit unless your big on campus activities -- if you know what I mean!?
author: Kat R.

description:
Can I just say that cash only bars blow goats?  I NEVER have cash.  I feel awful for all of my friends that I have mooched off of every time we go to Loa (which is often) because I always make them buy me drinks.  Damn you cash only...

Other than that, Loa is awesome.  Every time I go in, I contemplate how I am going to steal the racecar light over the pool table.  It is so freaking awesome and it would look killer in my basement.  I like the basketball game in the back - not so typical - I dig it.

This is a fun, low key place where I've blacked out a FEW too many times, I'm always sure to bump into someone I don't want to, and someone I adore.  LOVE IT.
author: Caitlin D.

description:
The first time I ever walked by this place, I heard a girl laughing hysterically inside and, when I turned to look, she fell out of the window onto Fillmore Street.  She picked herself up, dusted herself off, and went back inside and kept drinking.  I wasn't thinking fast enough to get the jeweler on the phone and go propose to her, but I did fall in love with the bar.

Cash only, and more often than not someone in there is looking for a fight.  But there are a lot of Cal alumni here so it's a mini reunion every time.  They stopped serving High Life in bottles, which is a crying shame.  Good drink specials during the week.  Well kept foosball table and Pop a Shot will keep me coming back.
author: Geoff K.

description:
Expecting a svelte bar with club music, contemporary decor, and the dim lighting that'll set a pretentious lounge mood? This is not your place.

By the bar's name, I was expecting a tiki bar feel. The decoration only kind of lives up to that expectation. Then again, I don't go to a bar only for its decor. It's more of a homey, somewhat tiki, bar decoration with a pool table, bowling video game, and hoop game stuck in. At the least, you can be entertained by the games if not the alcohol.

I came here on a Saturday night for a bachelorette party. It started off slow because there were only a handful of people at the first station and none at the second station. We ended up moving to that second station, manned by a blonde female (didn't get her name) and she was part of the reason we all had a fun time. She was great with the drinks but also was an active participant in our party. When we asked her to make a drink that she didn't know, she looked it up on her phone and made adjustments (after asking us if that was ok). 

The crowd is your usual Marina, young professionals and college crowd. They were quite friendly this particular night, trying to help us with completing the tasks on the bachelorette party list. I'll have fond memories of the stupid stuff we did in the name of the bachelorette.
author: Gwen L.

description:
You know you have a girlfriend for life when you both can talk about how some hot loser you met  back in the day took you here on a first 'getting to know you' kind of date...

and then realize it's the same guy you are talking about!!!! Small city... Ha!  Most girls would be ridiculous about that sort of thing...

No, but I sometimes stumble into this place.....it is a dirty boy's cave for sure.  Lots of them tumbling around and about, looking for trouble, but somehow - it just doesn't appeal to me in the same way!
author: Yelper A.

description:
Mauna Loa is the Marina bar that all of your friends who like the Marina try to drag you too, assuring you that "it's totally not a Marina bar!"

Yes it is.

Don't get me wrong, I love the fact that they have Big Buck Hunter and yes, drinks are a little cheaper than your average Marina watering hole.  Still the crowd is 100% Marina - just dressed down a little.  (Read - the collar on the polo shirt is not popped).

3 stars, because on a slow Tuesday, this can be a fun place to come to play a little foosball, the aforementioned BBH, and get some drinks.  If you've got to come, come on a weekday - on the weekend, it's too crowded to even move.
author: Adam B.

description:
My first impression of Mauna Loa was that it was kind of confused.

It's called Mauna Loa and there are a few island decorations on the wall, but it's not a tiki bar by any stretch of the imagination.

There were some flat screens with the game on but not enough to make the place a sports bar.

And maybe this is a dive bar by marina standards, but anywhere else it wouldn't be seedy enough for the label.

It is, however, an unpretentious neighborhood bar in a part of town that sorely needs unpretentious neighborhood bars. Good beers on tap and the staff is friendly and quick, though pints are a little more expensive than one would expect. I wouldn't cross town to come here but it's useful if you're in the area and want to get away from backwards baseball caps and attitude.
author: matthew r.

description:
Bars with pop-a -shot automatically get my vote. I know. Its juvenile to love a bar with a pool and Foosball table in addition to the "amazing game where you can exhibit your endless basketball skill while drunk  off your ass." Its a lot harder than people think - just imagine very sloppy drunk people trying to use coordination armed with nothing but raw talent and tiny basketballs the size of a baby's head. 

I digress. Its a fun, lowbrow joint that serves up plenty of self entertainment and takes you back to the days where you wish you could borrow your sister's fake ID and be part of the cool crowd. Now that I have had plenty of years of imbibing under my belt, I still stand behind this establishment. Its never let me down in the sense that there is always beer flowing and fun games to partake in. Hint: Games are a great segue for a bunch of drunkards to get to know each other. So key. 

Needless to say its way better than the beer pong playing, college frat boy crowd at the Bar None. This is not to say ML doesn't get some overflow. You've been warned. Its the friggin Marina. If you actually expect to go somewhere here and not run across the intensely vapid schmoes that inhabit this area than you are even more deluded than they are!
author: Stacy T.

description:
I like to think of Mauna Loa as a Chuck-E-Cheese for adults. You can play pool, foosball, Buck Hunter, and the bane of my existence Pop-A-Shot all while pounding back a few beers. 

It may be smack in the middle of the Marina (you will find some of the typical Marina crowd there) but its more down to earth than the rest of the bars in the area. The crowd seems to be more mellow. 

The drinks are relatively cheap and they even have Pabst Blue Ribbon, but I am still waiting for the day that Mauna Loa starts serving Natty Ice. 

Make sure you bring enough singles (not to put in the panties of the Marina girls) for the games. I think I end up spending 20 bucks on drinks here and another 20 on the games.
author: Arin N.

description:
The only reason I keep ending up at this place is that my best friend is addicted to pop-a-shot. Yeah, the arcade basketball game. I play foosball while he plays pop-a shot, and everyone's happy.

So why do don't I like this place? The entire front of the bar is full of triangle bar spillover. They have a pretty average beer selection and it's cash only. Here's the killer, though: This guy who thinks he is a pro foosball player shows up on peak nights and clowns everyone in the bar. He just cleans up. It's not for money or anything -- this guy just likes to beat up on drunk idiots. It would be like if I enjoyed picking fights with kindergarteners. It's not even fun to play him. I have seen him pumping quarters into the foosball table by himself on a saturday night, just setting up the ball in a particular position and practicing moves without an opponent. He even brings his own silicone lubricant so that the handles glide more smoothly. Having really serious people around takes all the fun out of being drunk.
author: Derek S.

description:
The number one reason people come to Mauna Loa is to play pop-a-shot (the basketball game). They also have a jukebox, pool table, foosball, buckhunter and other retro video games in the back.  I've had both good and bad experiences here. About every other time I come it smells like someone threw up on my face and wouldn't let me take a shower for three days. The other times it smells like a bar and I grab a beer and play a few games of pop-a-shot followed by some foosball.

This bar is definitely better when it isn't packed with people, but what bar isn't?

Another cash only bar. They also have a patio out back and I've been here twice when they've randomly been having a free bbq if you're drinking.
author: Jackie G.

description: Fantastic service on Mondays. There is an amazing woman who is so kind and personable. And get this, she even makes food for the bar patrons! Five stars for excellent service.
author: elly w.

description:
HaHaHa DIVE BAR INDEED!

Cash only which I detest. 

BUT they have a basketball game in the back ,and after several beers, I DOMINATE!
author: Nancy B.

description:
Aaarggh.

It is not so much that I dislike Mauna Loa per se- it's a fratty bar in a fratty neighborhood, and lordy knows I've been to my fair share of those. I mean, some of my best friends were in a fraternity, and I spent many a night singing their charming ditties and hazing their pledges. And, I think that my 1,353rd night out in a fratty bar won't kill me. I would just rather spend my valuable time elsewhere now that I live here in fabulous San Frnacisco.

Somewhere without a hoopy hoop machine.

And without people who are excited about hoopy hoop.

Even my fraternity guy friends have moved past the hoopy hoop. Some of them have turned 30, after all.

But not so the people at Mauna Loa! They're also 30... but still excited about hoopy hoop and Deer Hunter. I also feel like this is a place that people go when they don't know what else to do- "Meh, let's go to Mauna Loa."

To that I say "Meh, let's just not and say we did. BORING."

But, there are a few good things about this place.
1. Second bar- keeps things moving (but it's cash only)
2. Lots of bar stools
3. We snuck an entire bottle of tequila in here, it was still sealed and we were not planning on opening it (carrying it around for a passed out bday girl), but we did it! And then I hid it under the sink in the bathroom so I wouldn't have to haul it around. Genius, yes?

So, in conclusion: Mauna Loa= my night has been a bust.
author: Katie H.

description:
random find during a random Tuesday afternoon mimi pub crawl.

jukebox (always a plus in my mind) fast and super friendly service! hilarious regulars who both entertained and bought us shots! plus a complimentary fancy cheese and cracker tray?? hell yes!!

A strong recommendation for non-douchebagery in the douchebag prone marina.
author: Caddy M.

description:
Been here a few times, never during peak bar hours and have found a haven.

My last experience was a Monday evening with a couple of friends around 7ish. Just a few older gentlemen at the bar, and Tammy the bartender.

There were FREE hot dogs and oxtail chili that Tammy made for everybody. Simply incredible.

3.50 for a pint of Great White Ale, my favorite. Tammy just wanted to make us happy, she let us sample any beer that we weren't sure about and kept coming over to our table just to give us cups full of goldfish snacks and peanuts. Between Tammy (the grandmother -figure I always wanted) the cheap beer, good music, relative calm and pop-a-shot basketball, it was the best monday night ever.

Once again . . .FREE hot dogs monday nights. Don't know if the chili is there everytime or Tammy just made it to be lovable.
author: Mark B.

description:
-One star for not being KT's.
-One star for having a second bar near the back to ease some congestion.
-One star for some pretty hot ladies.
-Minus one star for many of those sluts refusing to acknowledge me. 
-Two stars for the arcade-style basketball game in the back.
-Minus one star for groups of junior investment bankers playing Big Buck Hunter with entirely too much enthusiasm.
author: Sam M.

description: This place is a mixed bag of experiences. It's got a dive look and feel but if you ever have been during a weekend night, it's packed to the gills meat market style. I've nearly gotten into fights and yet have had strangely good times too. The last time I was here my friend decided he'd hold his bday in the back bar and since we absolutely owned that area, the booze was flowing, and no one our party of 20 were sober. That included his parents. When everyone's having a good time it's easy to ignore everything else that's going on. However as a regular hangout I'd say there were many better places but it's good for the unusual people watching every now and then.
author: Kim N.

description:
One of my favorite places to drink when I lived in SF in the early 90's, and so I was so pleased to be able to drop in for a pint last week and revisit my old haunt.

This place has not lost any of its character in all these years, and it's just heartwarming as hell to see that ever-distinctive yellow lighted Mauna Loa sign.

Good jukebox.  Crappy parquet wooden half-circle bar.  20 beers on tap.  Solid mai tai.  What's not to love?  Praying that places like the Loa can last over time.
author: Brad P.

description:
I can't.  I mean, I just can't.  
OK, fine.  Maybe just a bit.  
I have been here many times.  Because I have co-workers that love the place.  My God, do I hate it.  Every time I come here I remember why I don't live in the Marina.  Sure, if I were in college, I would love this bar.  I loved the Marina when I was in college.  But, see, I was 20.  I had bad taste.  I think that was pretty apparent to those who knew me when I was 20.
Mauna Loa.  
I can't.  I mean, I just can't.
author: Blake W.

description: Terrible bar tenders, and their anchor steam was flat. Seriously flat, like less than a 2 mm of head. They kept insisting that it was 'just tapped' and 'fine'. Also they close around 1:30, can't really call yourself a dive bar if your last call isn't really last.
author: Zach H.

description:
Mauna Loa is easily one of my favorite dives in San Francisco.  True, it's a little small, and the no-credit law is a little bit on the annoying side, but where else can you play big game hunter and pop-shot while still being surrounded by yuppies?  
The drinks are stiff, ambiance is cool, and it's always a fun time.  Just make sure you bring lots of cash and face away from the men's bathroom door.  Good thing I'm an exhibitionist.
author: Patrick M.

description:
This place is a-ok but not the best the Marina has to offer...or is it?
I've been here a couple times for some juke box tunes and cheap drink specials but there's nothing super special about this place.
They do have some antique video and canival games which really amuses me, however, the only men in the bar seemed to be utterly occupied by these games.
I've never been here when it's been super packed, but I wouldn't go if it was.
author: Dani B.

description: Fun bar- has foosball and a basketball game. We had a good time.  1 star removed for their cash only policy!
author: Stephanie C.

description:
I couldn't bring myself to pick the first verse over the second or vice versa. they both express my heartfelt emotions equally:

So you wanna die, commit suicide
Dial 1-800-Cyanide line
Far as life, yo it ain't worth it
Put a rope around your neck and jerk it
The trick didn't work
Your life was fucked up from the first day of birth
After watching Jackie Gleason walk into a precinct
Gun down the captain for no fucking reason
And get some LSD or a drink from the bar
Get behind your wheel and crash the car
Like Desert Storm, got bombs for the war
confront an alligator, let it eat ya raw
Back to the function, riding the caboose to hell
BZZZZZT touched the third rail.
You fucked up chicken, now you just got fried
